intro: Tetrapterys gracilis, commonly known as the slender-leaved acanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and a distinctive, spiny calyx that persists on the fruit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Tetrapterys gracilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and unique floral structure.
